results.title: The New kid
results.creator_credit: Dick Gilbert, Ron Rolla and King Screen Productions
results.brief_description: Portrays the difficulties and adjustments that a child faces when they move to a new and unfamiliar neighbourhood. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The New job
results.creator_credit: Dan Klugherz and Dan Klugherz Film Productions
results.brief_description: Focuses on the activities of private US corporations in providing vocational training and jobs for under-privileged and under-educated men and women, who live in ghettos across the country.

results.title: The New Italian
results.creator_credit: Joseph Krumgold, Michael Alexander, National Educational Television, Westinghouse Broadcasting and Intertel
results.brief_description: Using the small village of Gerrandina in the south as an example, this is a survey of the Italian government’s attempt to deal with Italy’s surplus population. Formerly this problem had been solved by immigration, but now land reform and more industrialisation are bringing more work and better living conditions to the southern Italian peasant

results.title: The New friend
results.brief_description: Adaptation of the book “The New friend” by Charlotte Zolotow in which two young girls are best friends and constant companions until suddently one of the girls finds someone new to play with. Tis leaves her former friend hurt and confused.

results.title: The New epidemic
results.creator_credit: Susan Cornwell, Peter Thompson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The Adverse Drug Reaction Advisory Committee monitors doctors, dentists and chemists for adverse drug effects. The monitoring program emphasises the genuine need for good information on the use and effects of drugs. The film presents seven dramatised case studies based on real-life stories reported to the Committee.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Susan Cornwell, Peter Thompson and Film Australia

results.title: The New councillor
results.brief_description: Through the experiences of Richards, a newly elected borough councillor, shows the varied activities of a typical councillor - the people’s relationship both with the people who elected him and the permanent officials who carry out the policy laid down by the council.

results.title: The New boys
results.creator_credit: John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: St. John’s Cathedral Boys’ School, at Selkirk, Manitoba, is the most demanding outdoor school in North America, but it cannot accommodate all the students who would like to enroll. Boys of thirteen to fifteen begin with an initiation tougher than they have ever faced: paddling canoes through some five hundred kilometers of wilderness in two weeks, portaging and camping all the way, learning not only outdoor lore but cooperation and self-confidence as well.

results.title: The New baby
results.brief_description: The daily care of a new baby; breast and bottle feeding; causes of crying between feeds; sleep and coverings; vitamins and orange juice; bathing and suitable types of clothes; the importance of care and affection at all times and of helping the other children in the family adjust to the new arrival.
